results.title: Climate in crisis
results.creator_credit: Jeff Gale, Judith John-Story, David Mason, Jeremy Evans, BBC-TV and For Beyond Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Beyond 2000”.
A “Beyond 2000”, joint B.B.C. production which gives an overview of the problems associated with the Greenhouse Effect. A series of small episodes which clearly explains what the Greenhouse Effect is and its impact on the earth both now and in the future. The programs also discuss stategies and plans that may help turn around the environmental exploitation of our finite resources.

results.title: Nobody's children
results.brief_description: Looks at the issue of homelessness and youth in Australia. Part One called “No place like home” examines the growing underclass of alienated and dispossessed children in Australia. Part Two, entitled “Making it work”, looks at the effect of the collapsed youth job market on kids locked out of the workforce and at school.

results.title: Earthlings can do anything
results.brief_description: This is a video package for upper primary school students which can be used in a number of curriculum areas, most appropriately for science/technology studies and careers/personal development. The emphasis is on developing the talents and skills of girls in traditional male dominated curriculum areas.

results.title: The Global warming. Parts 1 & 2
results.creator_credit: Jean-Marc Seban, Mark Redhead, London Weekend Television and Vision Group
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Climate & man”.
Global Warming and the Greenhouse Effect are no longer unknown scientific concepts. They affect all people on the globe, and the prevention of further deterioration of the environment and atmosphere are critical issues facing governments. This comprehensive examination of the the causes and implications of greenhouse and global warming also looks at possible strategies which will in time slow down the devastation caused by these phenomena.

results.title: The Valley
results.creator_credit: Roger Scholes, Katherine Scholes and Edward Street Films
results.brief_description: Produced with the co-operation of the local community and World Vision Ethiopia staff in the Omo Valley, this film traces transformation of an area devastated by drought and land degradation into green and productive land, reversing the trend of environmental destruction and poverty.

results.title: Behind the seams: designing and manufacturing clothing in Australia
results.creator_credit: Peter Wiseman and Video Education Australasia
results.brief_description: Not an expose on high fashion, but a look at how clothing is made in a modern mass production factory. The programme is intended to erase any pre-conceived ideas about the factory as a dangerous, unpleasant workplace. The viewer is shown the manufacturing process from concept and design, to the finished garment. Divided into two parts entitled, Fashion and design” and “The Factory floor.

results.title: Legal nightmare
results.brief_description: Overviews the legal profession as a whole, in terms of the charges for services they provide and the effect of these fees on the clients who need to seek legal advice. The legal profession in Australia, with its distinction between barristers and solicitors, is full of “archaic rules and traditions” which, when combined with the increasing costs of legal fees, raises the question of justice and its real cost.
